lead_paragraph: The triple jumper Kenta Bell, who placed third at last month’s United States championships, admitted to a positive doping test from the meet. The United States Anti-Doping Agency announced that Bell tested positive for the banned substance methylprednisolone and accepted a first-offense suspension of three months. But because Bell, 30, completed an antidoping educational program, he received a three-month deferment, allowing for an immediate return to competition. Bell used a prescribed medication under the care of a physician but without first seeking a therapeutic use exemption as required by World Anti-Doping Agency rules.
